Will I become the person to create life for the sake of the gift of life, or only to tear it away again immediately?
What sort of person am I? In this case, my morals must serve as a guide.
book.spectrum.guidebook.spawner_manipula:
My new [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) enchantment finally allowed me to get Spawners to drop. Look what I got here!\
While I haven't yet figured out how to make these constructs myself, I'm starting to feel comfortable altering their properties in my favor, thanks to the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller).\
*This gon be gud.*
Increases the number of creatures summoned with each spawn cycle.
Lowers both min and max spawn delay.

Spawners seem to naturally stop spawning creatures when there are a lot of them around. Almost as if they want to give me a chance. *Pathetic, isn't it? As if I needed that.*\
This modification increases the number of creatures that are allowed to be near the Spawner.
Increases the distance I can be away from a spawner and it still works.
book.spectrum.guidebook.spirit_instiller:
With all the knowledge I gathered, I created the **Spirit Instiller**. I specifically designed it to combine the energies of two items, with the help of a third object to bind them.\
Like the others, the Spirit Instiller needs a focus structure to work. To rotate the structure hologram in the direction I want it to go, I am able click on the Spirit Instiller when it is placed.
An almost spiritual process, hence the name.

Dimensions: 8x9x5 blocks\
It can be enhanced by placing [Upgrades](entry://magical_blocks/upgrades) on the two [#](bb00bb)Onyx Chiseled Blocks[#]().

- 1 Spirit Instiller
- 2 Item Bowls
- 2 Notched Polished Blocks
- 2 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 2 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 6 Polished Pillars
- 17 Polished Slabs
- 41 Polished Blocks
- 2 Gemstone Chimes
book.spectrum.guidebook.staff_of_remembr:
*One to rule them all*\
...well, politely, of course.\
\
The Staff of Remembrance allows me to move around my animals with ease, over both short and long distances.
Tapping animals recollects them into a [Memory](entry://creating_life/memories).
book.spectrum.guidebook.star_candy.page0:
Baked [Stardust](entry://general/stargazing@stardust) tastes strangely refreshing - the magic made my tongue tingle as the heaven-sent candy dissolved in my mouth, and I felt strangely healthier afterwards. Its hard, golden flesh has a few purple flecks that shimmer like shards of stars.\
\
*I have long since stopped asking myself why I taste everything I come across.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.star_candy.page1: Perhaps the speckles are the source of its restorative properties? I wonder if it is possible to create a completely purple one.
book.spectrum.guidebook.star_candy.page2:
Now THAT's a tasty one!\
Just touching those star-strudded strips gave me the same tingling sensation as eating the whole thing before.
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.name: Stargazing
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page0: The calmness of the night often invites me to lie in the grass and watch the stars.
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page1:
The small Shooting Stars are made of a material unknown to me thus far.\
\
Can I catch one right out of the sky?\
\
*I am sure they are even easier to spot when I am using a Telescope or Night Vision.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page2:
Now that I've collected all variants, it's time to unwind! Hardened with a Diamond, stars won't break anymore when hit.\
\
*Fancy a Starball tournament with friends?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page3:
Shooting Stars yield valuable resources: a Star Fragment, Stardust and a variety of other rare materials.\
\
Picking up a Shooting Star by crouching and [crushing it with an Anvil](entry://general/item_crushing) will yield double the Star Fragments, albeit at the cost of the other loot.
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page4:
A powder of unknown origin blessed with the soul of the stars.\
\
*Bears coy, yet latent power.*
Knowing me, I will create the perfect tool, only to have it fall into Lava five minutes later in a moment of derangement. And then there is the dimension of the Endermen, which dramatically punishes any mistakes.\
\
This new enchantment will protect my favorite tools in case of brainfart (including being thrown against a cactus).
Protects tools from damage when on the ground, even from Lava or falling into the Void.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to all tools.
[#](449900)Decreases my attack speed[#]() with every level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.storage_node.pag:
The Storage Node shows its greatest use in combination with [Sender Nodes](entry://pastel_network/sender_node) (will push to it), [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node), and [Buffer Nodes](entry://pastel_network/buffer_node) (will pull from it).\
\
Its [#](449900)filter[#]() allows me to specify which items it will receive & provide. An empty filter makes the connected inventory act as a general store for all types of items.
book.spectrum.guidebook.storm_stones.pag:
Storms are a powerful manifestation of Mother Nature.\
Using the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine) I even started one while I was crafting [some powerful resources](entry://general/onyx_shards).\
\
There is no doubt that I will find something related to them that can help me on my journey.

Dug into the ground by lightning strikes, I found these stones, vibrating in my hand with barely contained energy.\
Used in the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine), I can summon another thunderstorm with ease.\
\
*Because of their volatile nature, they don't react too well to explosions...*
book.spectrum.guidebook.stratine.name: Stratine
book.spectrum.guidebook.stratine.page0.t:
This very heavy ore is scattered throughout the depths of the Nether.\
It is probably not the best idea to carry large amounts of it home at once.
book.spectrum.guidebook.stratine.page2.t:
Stratine - as I already discovered - is an exceptionally heavy material. And difficult to shape. Even the blazing heat of the Nether did it no harm.\
\
However, shaping it with my [Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) should be no problem at all.
Curiously, the combination of mushrooms and water is a perfect receptacle for all sorts of other floral notes - either rounding out the taste, or creating... very peculiar ones.\
\
Each flower has a specific effect, as if I were feeding it to a [#](449900)Brown Mooshroom[#]().
The fermentation process in colored wood makes the effect last quite a bit longer compared to [](item://minecraft:suspicious_stew).
[#](449900)Increases my attack speed[#]() with every level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.take_off_belt.pa:
Climbing mountains or misshapen caves is time consuming. If I don't see a way to scramble up an uneven ledge, I've had no choice but to carve a path into the rock - until now!\
With my new belt here I'm able to put great vertical distances behind me, sparing me time and the beautiful nature from destruction.

Sneak to charge a high jump, getting more powerful the longer I charge.\
\
*Even if the name implies it, please don't take it off.*
Increases the jump height even further.
Will give me a short slow fall effect, allowing to better navigate where to land. A high level of Feather Falling may be a viable way to get back down those cliffs again safely, actually.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.name: Tarts
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.page0.text:
Although I am not the most skilled chef, even this rudimentary one tastes great!\
\
I can additionally garnish it with various toppings to grant me [#](449900)defensive abilities[#]() for a short duration.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.page3.text:
Makes me able to see and swim in Lava as if it were Water.\
However, does NOT make me immune to fire.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.page4.text: Allows me to swim at light speed and greatly increases my underwater mining rate.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.page5.text: Makes me feel well rested, like after a good night's sleep. Chases away the creatures of nightmares.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.page6.text: Gives me a small chance that projectiles will simply deflect off of me.
book.spectrum.guidebook.the_art_of_brewi:
The [Titration Barrel](entry://cuisine/titration_barrel) is capable of brewing alcoholic beverages. If you are of legal drinking age in your country and want to engage with recipes mentioning alcohol, you can press the button below to unlock these recipes.\
If not don't worry - you won't miss out on anything important.

Fermentation is a very natural process - things take time and care. As there is never a completely controlled environment, there are a lot of variables.\
I can follow the recipe to the letter, or play around a bit. Fermentation is an Art!

- Time: It takes time for the barrel to influence the contents. Most drinks will develop more intense and even additional effects if given more time than strictly necessary
- Temperature: The hotter it is, the more of the precious contents will simply evaporate over time. This is called the angel's share

- Humidity: The more humid the air, the more water will evaporate compared to the alcohol, making the drink stronger
- Water Share: A higher ratio of ingredients to water is a fine balance, but one to be played with. A higher thickness makes the drink ferment faster, albeit at the cost of shorter duration status effects
book.spectrum.guidebook.the_perfect_comp:
The results of my [last experiment](entry://general/failing) make me long for more: how much power can I squeeze out of these gemstones?\
I am sure there's more, and [Neolith](entry://general/neolith) must will be my entry gate! With such coherence, it may allow me to unite the powers of all the gems into one. This relic shall be the capstone to my creation, my personal Philosopher's stone, making me a living god!

Requires daytime and a clear sky.\
\
The fusion of these magical energies will stress my Fusion Shrine like nothing before - with a display to match. Best to make sure it and the blocks around it are fortified and isolated.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tight_grip.page0:
It almost seems like a fever dream when I remember being able to strike with weapons faster than I can think. Nowadays, each blow costs me so much energy that I have to pause for a moment.\
*Maybe I'm getting old.*\
\
With a few adjustments to my weapon, I can reduce this downtime somewhat.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tight_grip.page1:
Decreases attack cooldown.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to melee weapons.
book.spectrum.guidebook.titration_barrel:
The idea of fermenting [food](entry://cuisine/titration_barrel@kimchi) and [drinks](entry://cuisine/infused_beverages) in [Colored Wood](entry://general/colored_trees@colored_wood) was not far to seek.\
Over time, the properties of the wood affect the contents. The results are sometimes more delicious, sometimes less delicious (though the latter could be due to my cooking skills), but always interesting.\
\
The barrel holds up to a stack of items and one bucket of liquid.
*Sometimes it feels like that when I blink the world has ceased to exist? Each time the barrel fermentation process seems to have progressed.*
Fermentation is not just for drinks! Made from 2 different vegetables, Kimchi is a hearty dish, best served as a side.
Takes a little time, but more efficient than just throwing the ingredients together.
Slightly fermented, it still retains the properties of [Milk](item://minecraft:milk_bucket). Eating it will remove any status effects currently active.

A great snack. Biting off a piece is quick and even makes me feel reasonably full.\
Pleasantly sweet and fruity.
An elaborate feast of flavors that makes my mouth water just thinking about it.
Perfect for relaxing, and refreshing in the cold season.
book.spectrum.guidebook.totem_pendant.pa:
[#](bb00bb)Totems of Undying[#](), while powerful, have the significant disadvantage of requiring me to hold them in my hand at all times.\
\
Using the protective powers of [Blue Pigment](entry://general/pigment@blue) as a focus I can keep the totem's life-saving effect active even when worn around the neck.
One-time protection from death. Disintegrates into dust once triggered.
[#](449900)Weakened powerful attacks[#]() that hit me.\
While great against single, deadly blows, it did little against many small attacks.
I recently completed a painting, showing a fantastic creature that has appeared in my dreams: apparently made of [#](bb00bb)Soul Sand[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Wither Skeleton Skulls[#](). I waited in a Nether Fortress for hours, trying to recreate it, only to nearly lose my own head while searching for a Wither Skeleton with a spine loose enough to drop its skull. Heads up, I never were the one to bury my head in the sand.

Then I remembered the Creepers! After being struck by lightning, they explode with such force that they blow their enemies' heads right off their necks (worst case: mine).\
To replicate this, I came up with an enchantment using [Storm Stones](entry://general/storm_stones).\
And so Treasure Hunter was born, allowing me to collect [all kinds of Mob Heads](entry://creating_life/mob_heads).

Occasionally drops Mob Heads on kill.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to axes and melee weapons.\
Mutually exclusive with Looting.
book.spectrum.guidebook.trifles.name: Trifles
book.spectrum.guidebook.trifles.page0.te:
Sweet delicacies, guaranteed to give me more than just a sugar rush - depending on the toppings.\
Made from [Jaramel](entry://general/jade_vines@jaramel), [#](449900)Gelatin[#]() & [Amaranth](entry://cuisine/amaranth).\
\
*Even the simple one tastes great!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.trifles.page3.te: Gives random effects. Do I fancy a gamble?
book.spectrum.guidebook.tuning_stamp.pag:
An essential part of network management is being able to fine-tune where and how things go around. This crystal stamp allows me to manually add and remove pastel nodes from networks.\
\
[#](449900)Redo[#]() a preexisting connection to unlink it.\
[#](449900)Shift-right-click[#]() to remove all connections.
*How else would I connect them? They aren't just going to automatically hook up into a mess on their own, that'd be silly!*
Pastel Node Upgrades

Oh, how cruel, how terribly cruel - that my creation is *not good enough!* Such a lacking system is below me, this cannot stand.\
\
After thinking about it a while, the solution is evident. I can use the rings of light surrounding the nodes to enhance them (which, of course, was part of my designs), all it takes is the right material...

Every node that can provide items has two ring-slots for upgrades. These rings can have upgrades applied by interacting with them, and removed via sneak-interaction. Upgrades of the same nature will stack with each other, though often not linearly.\
\
*The upgrades always apply on the source node.*
Enhancing Nodes
Transfer Upgrades

Slightly reduces [#](449900)travel time[#]().\
\
*Latency can be a problem sometimes.*

Significantly reduces [#](449900)travel time[#]().\
\
*Travel time? Never heard of it.*

+1 row of [#](449900)filter slots[#]()\
[Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node) gain twice as many rows.\
\
*Filter? I barely know her!*

+2 rows of [#](449900)filter slots[#]()\
[Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node) gain twice as many rows.\
\
*...not that I would mind it, though.*

Increases the [#](449900)amount of items transferred[#]() per batch.\
\
*Are dragons this stacked?*

Significantly increases the [#](449900)amount of items transferred[#]() per batch.\
\
*All the things, all at once!*

Significantly boosts [#](449900)transfer rate[#]().\
\
*Steady? No. Slow? Also no!*
Decorative Upgrades
It's not always about being efficient. Sometimes I just want by creations to look cool. Decorative upgrades have no practical use but are pretty.
Makes the node [#](449900)glow brightly[#]().
Redstone Upgrades
Redstone Integration Upgrades

Pure Redstone is, rather predictably, an excellent way to power things. Applying this to a node will force it to always be on.\
\
*Cinnabar Dream*

Sometimes I just need to invert signaling but there is not enough space to flip things around. Pure Coal will do that without any additional space or mess.\
\
*Black is the new Red*

Echo is a really curious thing, and one I've honestly had trouble finding a use for. It seems its sonar qualities are excellent for detecting items passing by a node, producing an ephemeral redstone pulse.\
\
*Resonance Cascade*

There are cases where I want to have a node be just permanently disabled, Lapis does just that. It is great for, well\
I can go ahead and\
Well it could be the case that\
\
*Why did I make this?*

Fine control over the flow of transmissions bears some utility. Through the use of Pure Quartz I can make it so the node will only activate when pulsed by redstone, where it will send one packet.\
\
*One Step at a Time*

Making these things glow is quite nice, but if I ever want to use one as a bedside lamp I need it to be able to turn off. Pure Glowstone achieves that, turning off when powered with redstone.\
\
*Comparatively Overpriced*
book.spectrum.guidebook.turn_back_to_pol: By applying heat, all blocks can be returned to their polished state.
book.spectrum.guidebook.universe_spyhole:
The creations that [Radiating Ender](entry://general/radiating_ender) allow me to create never cease to amaze me.\
\
Placed directly on a wall or on the ground, this strange block allows me to glimpse the other side, allowing me to discover cave systems and structures... or see the sky if I am underground!
*I now see what you did there*
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.name: Structure Upgrades
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page0.t:
The Pigment Pedestal and Fusion Shrine have already proven their worth. But there is always room for improvement. That's why I've created these upgrades. Each one improves the properties of my structures in a different way.\
\
Additional upgrades of the same type have a reduced effect.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page1.t: Crafting times have skyrocketed recently, mostly due to the more complex components. This will help me bring the times back to an acceptable level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page2.t: The Pedestal Accelerator T2 improves on its predecessor. Making crafting even more fast.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page3.t: Tier 3 leaves nothing to be desired - at least in terms of crafting speed.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page4.t: The amount of experience I get from crafting is negligible most of the time. But with this Focus I can dramatically increase it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page5.t: This improved Knowledge Focus increases crafting XP even more.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page6.t: Allows me to cushion the consumption of my structures a little.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page7.t: This 'upgrade of the upgrade' further reduces the use use of input materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page8.t:
Although the chance is very small, I can increase the results from crafting!\
*More bang for my buck!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page9.t: This upgraded version is much more powerful and has an even higher chance of increasing crafting output.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrading.text:
Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrading_enchan:
Enchantments and Color Magic have a lot in common. So I wasn't surprised when my first attempt to combine [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Books[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) was an instant success.[#]()\
\
Placing an [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Book[#]() on the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter), surrounding it with matching [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and providing a steady stream of experience will raise the level of the book.
Interrupting said process will stop it entirely.
book.spectrum.guidebook.use_in_potion_wo:
Use the [Potion Workshop](entry://brewing/potion_workshop) to infuse it, by placing it where the [#](bb00bb)Bottle[#]() would normally go.\
\
To clear its effect, put it in a crafting grid.\
The stored effect gets reapplied every 15 seconds.
book.spectrum.guidebook.mundane_items.pa: There are a few items that have always been difficult or even impossible to craft. My new skills make that *much* easier.
book.spectrum.guidebook.vanilla_enchantm:
The Enchanter is also able to create most enchantments I'm already familiar with.\
\
Those Enchantments can be upgraded to higher levels, too - using the same [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) used for creating it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.vegetal.page0.te:
The answer seemed to be organics! Easily digestible indeed. Quite of obvious in retrospect...\
When digested by the organism, they created an interesting byproduct which I called Vegetal, representing the **raw energy of nature**.\
\
I am sure it will be very useful to me down the line.
book.spectrum.guidebook.vulnerability.pa: [#](449900)Increased incoming damage[#]() with each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.weather_detector:
Citrine is very sensitive to the energies released during a storm.\
\
When exposed to rain or a thunderstorm, it emits a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().
Rain will give a strength 8 signal, thunderstorms a full 15.
book.spectrum.guidebook.weather_manipula:
I would like to note one observation:\
Not only does the environment have an influence on the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine), I have also noticed that the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine) has an influence on its surroundings!\
\
With the right combination of materials, I can influence the weather.

*It's a brand new day\
And the sun is high\
All the birds are singing\
That you're gonna die*

*Knock Knock\
Who's there?\
Accordion\
Accordion who?\
Accordion to the forecast, it's going to rain tonight.*

*Why did the god of thunder drink water?\
\
Because he was thorsty.*
These hostile underwater temples are hell to maneuver in. Coincidentally, I stumbled upon a [#](bb00bb)Heart of The Sea[#]().\
This circlet I built with it allows me to live underwater as if it were the most natural thing in the world. I mine and swim faster, require no air and can see better.\
\
It also heals my little close by Axolotl friends. ♥

*Have I ever wanted to live underwater?\
No? Whatever, now I can! Time to build an underwater base!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.weeping_gala.amp: Holds twice as much as a Barrel
book.spectrum.guidebook.weeping_gala.lam: Emits light if it receives a Redstone signal
book.spectrum.guidebook.weeping_gala.lan: I made two variants. I can switch between then by sneaking while placing it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.weeping_gala.pag:
Imposing willows adorned with pale leaves. The sprigs weep with a sticky, sweet resin that can be used as a [Milk](item://minecraft:milk_bucket) substitute. The wood is incredibly dense, making it much slower to burn than most other woods.\
\
I wonder how they grow so large when their leaves don't even have chlorophyll?
book.spectrum.guidebook.what_happened.pa:
*Tracing the history of the Deeper Down*.\
\
There is no doubt that, despite the lack of light, there must once have been a highly advanced civilisation down here. But all I have found are ruins.\
What happened? Surely I can find clues to their whereabouts. Demise? Legacy?
Is there a place I have not searched yet?
Now that Bedrock is no longer the bottom, *what* is there?
How were the ruins I found in the Overworld created?
How did the Black Langast come about?
Those bones in the Dragonrot Swamps... can they be broken?
What about those strange Crystals in the Crystal Gardens?
Can I find Geodes around here, too?
I searched far and wide for a place that I might could have missed. But no matter where I looked, there was not a single soul in sight.
Clue: Biomes
It's like turtles all the way down, isn't it? Until a moment ago I thought Bedrock was indestructible, an here I am. Unbreakable? Possibly. For now, at least.
Clue: Dimension Floor

Apparently Downstone was not completely indestructible to the previous inhabitants? It took immense, high-tech constructs, but they were able to process the stone and refine it into what I call "Preservation Stone".
Clue: Excavation Sites
The remains growing in [Black Langast](entry://dimension/black_langast) were actually Resonant Lilies, once. What happened here? Does this mean...
Clue: Black Langast

I keep coming across gigantic skeletons. Whether they were really dragons is still written in the stars, but whatever they were, they were certainly powerful. Did they wipe out the inhabitants and then somehow meet their own end?
Clue: Dragonbone
Literally humming stones with a lot of indwelling energy. When interacted with, they shake each other until they shatter without any further external influence. Usable as energy source?
Clue: Hummingstone
The dazzling white geodes down here are unlike any I have seen before, and hold immense magical power. But why do they only exist here? More questions...
Clue: Moonstone
book.spectrum.guidebook.whispy_circlet.p:
The bags under my eyes aren't the only evidence of my recent sleep deprivation. There are these creatures that emerged straight from the nightmares I skipped - almost as if they feel cheated.\
\
A countersolution: This manifestation of relaxation, no sleep necessary.

After just a few minutes of waring it, I feel physically and mentally refreshed and recover more quickly from any negative effects.\
\
*The pleasures of a good night's sleep.*
commands.spectrum.progression_sanity.suc: Результаты проверки рассудка отправлены в консоль сервера
container.spectrum.bedrock_anvil.tooltip: Add pigment to items to color their name
container.spectrum.rei.enchanting.title: Зачарования Spectrum
container.spectrum.rei.freezing.title: Заморозка
container.spectrum.rei.heating.title: Нагрев
death.attack.spectrum_deadly_poison: %1$s отравился смертельным ядом. Говорил я тебе, что это не кола
death.attack.spectrum_dike_gate: %1$s не приглашали, но он всё равно пришёл
death.attack.spectrum_incandescence.item: %1$s used %3$s to help %2$s become a star in bright vermilion - more kindling for the flame!
death.attack.spectrum_incandescence.play: %1$s увидел, как %2&s превратился в звезду и сгорел в атмосфере!
death.attack.spectrum_ink_projectile.ite: %2$s показал %1$s как правильно рисовать при помощи %3$s
%1$s was lost in Translation being chased by %2$s
death.attack.spectrum_primordial_fire.it: %2$s использовал %3$s для превращения души %1$s в тлеющую сажу
death.attack.spectrum_set_health: %1$s was sent to the shadow realm
death.attack.spectrum_set_health.item: %1$s был отправлен в царство теней благодаря %2$s при помощи %3$s
death.attack.spectrum_set_health.player: %1$s был отправлен в царство теней благодаря %2$s
death.attack.spectrum_shooting_star: %1$s был размазан падающей звездой. Загадайте желание!
death.attack.spectrum_sleep: %1$s was lost to a bottomless dream
death.attack.spectrum_sleep.item: %2$s used %3$s to send %1$s on, unto the bottomless sea, accepting of all that is and could be.
death.attack.spectrum_sleep.player: %2$s sent %1$s on, unto the bottomless sea, accepting of all that is and could be.
effect.spectrum.another_roll.desc: Влияет на выпадение предметов при помощи зачарований, зависящих от удачи.
